docs.title: /core/
docs.text: Core files of the project, load the rest of the code.

docs.title: /core/
docs.text: Core files of the project, load the rest of the code.

docs.title: asgi.py
docs.text:
ASGI config for the project

  • Set core.settings as settings module
  • Initialize asgi app
  • Websockets for chat

docs.title: DEBUG
docs.text: Whether server is in debug mode. Django adds more stuff for error messages, etc.

docs.title: INSTALLED_APPS
docs.text:
Apps that are installed

  • Django libraries
  • main.apps.MainConfig
  • api.apps.ApiConfig
  • chat.apps.ChatConfig
  • REST framework
  • REST API key
  • Cors headers

docs.title: LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL
docs.text: Where you are redirected after login, to profile page

docs.title: TEMPLATES
docs.text:
Template settings

  • Use Django template system
  • Look inside app folders
  • Preprocessors

docs.title: ASGI_APPLICATION
docs.text: The ASGI for the project. Set core.asgi.application

docs.title: AUTH_USER_MODEL
docs.text: The user model to use for authentication. Set to main.User

docs.title: REST_FRAMEWORK
docs.text:
Settings for the REST API.

Permissions: * Has API Key

docs.title: STATIC_ROOT
docs.text:
Where the static files are located in production

Warning

This only affects production. For development (when DEBUG=True) each /<appname>/static folders are used.

Run python3 manage.py collectstatic to collect all of the static files into the /backend/static folder.

Read the the official documentation for more info on static files.

docs.title: MEDIA_URL
docs.text: The url for user media (like profile pictures)

docs.title: MEDIA_ROOT
docs.text: The file path for the media folder

docs.title: DEFAULT_AUTO_FIELD
docs.text: Default primary key field type to use for models that don’t have a field with primary_key=True. Set to BigAutoField

docs.title: CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST
docs.text: Which domains the server can be hosted
